comments.body: I love this idea, not only for in case of spawning on a mushroom island, but also you can grow mushroom trees and that would be absolutely fantastic for building, so I am ALWAYS up to the idea of being able to have more types of wood to build with!
Or an alternative name: the blood melon, giving a small chance to effect the player with nausea.
I think this is a great idea. Also, I think that villages can generate with them but it should be rare.
cool idea I'm always tired of using rain or water buckets and bonemeal

mmm, dyed plywood would mean a lot of new blocks of the different types of wood(stairs, fences, etc.) which rapidly overwhelm the inventory.

Instead, I suggest the usage of Glue along with three different(optional, can be the same wood type) types of wood planks to craft plywood, this would be great as being an alternative to free the inventory, the other way is the usage of bundles, however, plywood can be used right away to craft sticks, torchs and then, tools.

Adding plywood to the game would be great considering the many types of wood there(birch, jungle, etc.)
If you get a double chest filled with shulkers, you can get lots things stored in it. Also, making more than one double chest isn’t hard.

I think it would be really useful but you would have to be able to make iron chests  (which for example would have more space than the double wooden chest) and double iron chests (which had twice the space of a simple iron chest)
You can always use redstone lamps and levers for that.
Moved from incorrect category.

I'd kind of like this, but the Nether trees aren't supposed to be flammable, so cooking them doesn't fit with their way of life. You can always craft sticks and cook with that instead, or use some tasty Nether Fortress or Piglin loot.
They're not supposed to burn
Should there be fungi sticks the exact same as sticks except not flammable like dig pointed out

It might make things a little too easy for the players who want a challenge as well. The nether has coal from wither skeletons and lava from essentially everywhere as fuel sources, so we don't really need fungus stems for that. Just as an extra note, this isn't something Mojang forgot to add. They may have originally set things up so that stems could burn, but the block tags recorded on minecraft.gamepedia show that this is intentional. So it seems like they may have considered using them as fuel, but decided against it. As I mentioned before, the minecraft wiki should have more info on this if you are interested in learning more.

Aren't the new wood variants actually some sort of fungi? That's why I thought they didn't burn.

And since they exist in the 'hell' dimension where there is lava everywhere, it can be assumed anything that could burn would have already since it's simply just that hot. Therefore, smelting with them wouldn't be hot enough for them to burn.

I love the most extreme challenges. I agree you defiantly don't want to make things too easy, but.. I currently made a single biome world of Crimson Forest, this has been a super fun challenge on Hardcore, but things are pretty tough so far and I was hoping for some charcoal from Crimson logs but none. To get an idea how hard this is.

[Apologize for off topic.]

No other mobs spawn but Zoglins and Zombie Pigmen because this is in the overworld. No minerals spawn, that means no coal, iron, diamonds. But you can get gold from netherack gold ore, and stone exists. There are chests with loot but its rather difficult to run around with no armor and fight Zoglins which spawn in day and night in close proximity, you pretty much have to live in a tree or live below ground with non spawning blocks as floor.
56 459yanis
Vorschlag: in den einstellungen kann man diese funktion mit den gräbern aus und anschalten

Even if we couldn't get the ruined portal thing, having a built in way to assign custom portals for getting to custom dimensions and what blocks/items that portal would need to be built out of and activated with would be wonderful!
This way datapack creators won't have to makeshift ways to detect their own makeshift portals, it could just be built right in!

Perhaps we could even get a selection of colors to choose from for the custom portals like in the 20w14∞ snapshot.

Additionally, if there was a colorless portal texture that would be given a tint based on the defined portal type this would offer more control of portals to other dimensions.

As far as the ruined portals go, I've found it to be fairly straightforward to just load the vanilla ruined portal structure files in an NBT editor and replacing the palette of blocks with the blocks I want, then having my datapack load my custom structures programmatically.
I agree and really like your idea, however Java already has custom dimensions with a custom coloured portal. If we had this in Bedrock I think that would be sick!
Amazing idea bro
This is an amazing idea! I love it. However, I feel this enchantment would be better used on shields.

Don't you realize you can just take away there permission to mine blocks. Also why are you traping people to get bedrock you must be in a creative world and then they can break them instantly. My opinion really bad idea. But maybe something stronger like obsidian
It is useless because you can't make it in survival but in creative you can ice normal bedrock

first, your friends would never come on a world with you, because they are trapped in a prison and cant get out. second, you can turn off their ability to mine blocks. third, you would never be able to aquire these, because you cannot get the bedrock needed in order to make them. 

In my opinion, this is just not a great idea.
It's be good for asthetics
Give, function, summon, particle, setblock

I’m sure the Dark Spear would be a pretty op weapon since tridents are very op already, despite that I really liked your idea. Hope they see it!

  And yes.. we NEED juices in the game!
Points for creativity.
I think maybe no on the wings and egg hatching part, but the rest seems pretty cool. I was also thinking about chorus fruit juice.
I think it should have a different name. I like this idea though!
I agree that it should have a different name, maybe Nether Flora. I always for more flowers in Minecraft for more decorating options.

I really like the new Nether flower idea and the idea of a potion to remove one random effect and then, with a boost, one random negative effect. I think these ideas could provide some fun combinations, such as this possible potion tree:

Nether wart + water bottle -> awkward potion

awkward potion + milk -> "remove one random effect potion"

"remove one random effect potion" + "new Nether flower" -> "remove one random negative effect potion"

"remove one random negative effect potion" + glowstone powder -> "remove all negative effects potion"

"remove one random negative effect potion" + fermented spider eye -> "remove one positive effect potion"

"remove one positive effect potion" + glowstone powder -> "remove all positive effects potion"

 

And then these potions can also be turned into splash potions, hence the reason for the branch of removing positive effects. (This might be too big of a tree, but it would be fun to have something like this.

this is a really creative idea, in one post youve created something with more use than any of the existing nether plants, i feel the name would probably be something more like "wastes poppy" but still very good
I think it would be cool if this could be accomplished by breaking a written sign with shears.
What about chat? Or the new emotes they will add?
Bigger lettering would be great too.
I like the idea of coating items in netherite so they don't burn but I think it should only apply to tools not consumables.

Why would you craft a food item, the BEST food item mind you, and craft it into a food item that harms you? Also this is just how netherite works, you should just say more items transformable into netherite. It would get more people to click your idea.
The idea is coating an item in netherite not completely adding netherite and Ik maybe adding netherite to consumables isn't favored by some but its just a suggestion
I was thinking that you could add it to Elytra or Shulker Boxes.

It would be immensly useful to make unburnable items by coating them with netherite. However I would only like to have that ability for tools and shulkerboxes.

edit: Including elytra of course

edit2: typo

I'm pretty sure that would defeat the purpose of netherite... I mean, it's a good idea, but why would I wear netherite if my diamond armour is fire proof? I know it gives some buffs too, but I think a better idea would be to make the netherite coating so thin that it's a one time use. When it drops out of your inventory, it is fire proof until it gets picked up by some one. Just so netherite armour isn't shoved out of the spotlight.

I really like this but not for the smithing table. Maybe they could add something like a forge and that could melt the netherite onto the item. This is something they should consider because I’m terrified of having shulker boxes and my elytra in the nether and around lava. They could make it as late game as they want and they could even add the dragon egg to the forge crafting recipe for all I care but I just want to be able to make unburnable items!
its getting added to bedrock in the nether update

It'd be nice if these three blocks (Allow, Deny, and Border blocks) were on Java too; seems more like a parity suggestion though. Would be handy for mapmaking or just for restricting in adventure mode maps without the need to spam barrier blocks all over the place when 1 Border block can do the job or use both to seal the map from exploits with ender pearls/chorus fruit to escape the map.
Honestly, this a great idea
I think a friend of mine would love this, he has no end of hassle using his horse around rivers.
Kind of overpowered, but COOL idea!!
You just want a reason to kill striders.

That's mainly determined by Simulation Settings- outside a certain distance, typically 8 to 10 chunks (~160 blocks max) simulations stop. It'd be nice if you got more distance as I'd then process ore while mining a ways below.
Exactly! Why would the furnace stop working if I'm not close to it. Furnaces in real life don't need my presence to work.

Yes, it is worthless to have to sit and wait for my stone to be completed. Why even use hoppers if I have to be close anyway? Seems like a no brainier. I strip mine and some of my runs are more than 3 or 4 hundred blocks from my mining base. I put in Orr and have to sit doing nothing while it smelts. With all of the amazing updates that are put out, how hard would it be to change this extremely unrealistic waist of time. Could you imagine not being able to leave your property because your oven will not work?
Good idea, but some people might not like it, as one of nether's main gimmicks is the no water.

This is solely to irrigate crops, so you won’t be able to put yourself out with it or anything like that. The water is basically just fuel in that way. I very much agree though, I want to keep the Nether challenging as well. I was actually thinking the same thing when I thought of this, which is why the recipe needs Blue Ice. I sort of figured the Blue Ice would keep the water from evaporating as usual.
You should also be able to fill it using a dispenser and a water bucket like the respawn anchor
That’s a great idea, I don’t know why I didn’t think of that before .
I think this is a great idea! It would be really usefull for on the spot garrot farming
I think iron and gold varieties would be nice, and it should replace horse armor in nether fortresses. The Nether has no horses.
Strider armor is an absolute must-have. For a mob that is meant to guide you through extensive lava lakes they are very easy to kill.
Maybe they wear just boots
i agree that nether needs a chest but idk about ur suggestions to what purpose it could serve

Amend 1

Addendum 1:......., and then stepping on it will die.

Change to

Addendum 1: ......., and then stepping on it will immediately die.
What if you want to build an underwater base, but want to use the dry textures of blocks? Then this feature may be destructive.
what if geodes formed in veins, with a boring smooth rock design on the outside, but crystal on the inside (like mushroom blocks)
hey dude ur lucky minecraft added it!!!
